fields_of_interest: Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Research and innovation, Digital economy and society, Borders and Security, Communication
eu_initiatives:
Mozilla is actively following a number of files related to internet policy, competition, innovation, and the rights of Internet users including: 
- The Digital Single Market Strategy, namely Copyright & E-Commerce 
- Security, Privacy, and Data Protection 
- Competition Policy 
- AI & Machine Learning 
- Government Surveillance 
- Net Neutrality 
- Disinformation
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations

commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: High-Level Expert Group on Fake News#E03567#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3567#Member#C#Sub Group 3 A Role and responsibilities of news media organisations/press
membership:
Mozilla is a member of the European Digital Media Association (EDiMA), the Computers & Communications Industry Association (CCIA), and the European Committee on Interoperable Systems (ECIS). 
 
europeandigitalmediaassociation.org 
 
ccianet.org 
 
ecis.org
goals__remit:
Mozilla’s mission is to promote openness, innovation, and opportunity on the Web. We build software such as Firefox, which is an openly developed and open source web browser. Firefox is used by hundreds of millions of people worldwide to discover, experience, and connect to the Web. Mozilla is also a non-profit foundation that educates and empowers Internet users to be the Web’s makers, not just its consumers. To accomplish this, Mozilla functions as a global community of technologists, thinkers, and builders who work together to ensure the Internet is a global public resource, open and accessible to all.  
 
https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/mission/
